thread.title: Major Fire Update Details - NSW Rural Fire Service
thread.title_full: Major Fire Update Details - NSW Rural Fire Service

title: Major Fire Update Details - NSW Rural Fire Service

organizations.name: major fire update details - nsw rural fire service emergency warning

text:
Emergency Warning - Spring Hill Rd, Dondingalong (Kempsey LGA) 2017-02-12 16:20 Posted: 2017-02-12 16:20 
An emergency warning is in place for the Spring Hill Rd, Dondingalong area, south of Kempsey due to a bush fire. The fire is out of control. 
Current Situation A bush fire is burning in the area of Spring Hill Road and Rainbows End Road, Dondingalong, 10km south of Kempsey. Properties are under direct threat. 
People in the area need to seek shelter as the fire front arrives. It is too late to leave. 
The fire is burning in Severe fire danger conditions. Under these conditions, fires are uncontrollable, unpredictable and fast-moving. 
Advice People in the area need to seek shelter as the fire front arrives. It is too late to leave. 
Other Information - If your life is at risk, call Triple Zero (000) immediately. - Continue to stay up to date with the bush fire situation by checking http://www.rfs.nsw.gov.au , listening to your local radio station or by calling the NSW RFS Bush Fire Information Line on 1800 679 737. - If you live in the area but are away from home, it may not be safe to return to your property. - For information on road closures, check http://livetraffic.rta.nsw.gov.au . Roads may be closed without warning. 
The next update on this fire will be issued by 12/02/2017 17:18 or if the situation changes.
